snippet: A series of bombings and shootings wounded more than 100 people across Iraq, just as the Muslim holy month of Ramadan drew to a close.
abstract: Series of bombings and shootings kills more than 100 people across Iraq just as the Muslim holy month of Ramadan draws to a close; attacks are part of an escalation of violence that has already claimed scores of lives since late July.

byline.contributor: Employees of The New York Times contributed reporting from Baghdad, Kirkuk, Diyala Province, Falluja and Mosul, Iraq.

lead_paragraph: A series of bombings and shootings wounded more than 100 people across Iraq, just as the Muslim holy month of Ramadan drew to a close.

headline.seo: Wave of Attacks Kills Dozens in Iraq
headline.main: Wave of Attacks Kills Dozens in Iraq
headline.print_headline: Attacks Strike Across Iraq, Killing Scores
